column2: onto the food. We came just as happy hour was closing
column3: but our waitress encouraged us to go ahead and order off the HH menu
column4: so that we did. From the happy hour menu we order the tartar (super flavorful and fresh
column8: ceviche for ants? it had beautiful plating/presentation but beautiful isn't gonna fill up my tummy)
column9: and a few rolls (nothing extraordinary here
column10: it is a happy hour). I'd definitely come and fill up on a few cheaper rolls to start then tuck into their main menu items
